intro: Arthropodium curvipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf yam, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. Its rhizomes are edible and have been used by Indigenous Australians for food and traditional medicine. Arthropodium curvipes thrives in wet or damp environments, often found in swampy areas or along waterways.
